samophis.lavalink.client.util

Class Asserter

  • java.lang.Object
    • samophis.lavalink.client.util.Asserter

  • public class Asserter
extends java.lang.Object
    Asserts that an object has to be not-null or that a number has to be positive.

    Used internally to test the above conditions to ensure some extent of safety.

    Since:
    0.3.3
    Author:
    SamOphis

    • Method Summary

      static int requireNotNegative(int number)
      Asserts that an integer must be positive (not-negative) and returns the provided integer if it is.
      static long requireNotNegative(long number)
      Asserts that a long must be positive (not-negative) and returns the provided long if it is.
      static <T> T requireNotNull(T object)
      Asserts that an object must be not-null and returns the provided object if it is.

      • requireNotNull

        @Nonnull
public static <T> T requireNotNull(T object)
        Asserts that an object must be not-null and returns the provided object if it is.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object.
        Parameters:
        object - An object to null-check.
        Returns:
        The provided object if it is NOT null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the provided object was null.

      • requireNotNegative

        @Nonnegative
public static int requireNotNegative(int number)
        Asserts that an integer must be positive (not-negative) and returns the provided integer if it is.
        Parameters:
        number - The integer to check.
        Returns:
        The integer if it was positive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided number was negative.

      • requireNotNegative

public static long requireNotNegative(long number)
        Asserts that a long must be positive (not-negative) and returns the provided long if it is.
        Parameters:
        number - The long to check.
        Returns:
        The long if it was positive.
